title: The Thin Blue Line That Stays Strangely Horizontal
summary:
Key ideas
- NOMINATE is a statistical system that determines which legislators are more liberal or conservative than others.
- Long-term legislators can be used to "bridge" different sections of Congress.
- DW-NOMINATE is an enhanced version of NOMINATE that can compare different sections of Congress.
- DW-NOMINATE has been recognized as broadly accurate and is used by Nate Silver.

Key learnings
- Congress is getting more polarized recently, and the Republicans took a big turn to the right starting in 1980.
- There has been no liberal drift of either party over the past 120 years according to DW-NOMINATE.

Key questions
- How can it be possible that there has been no liberal drift of either party over the past 120 years?
- Is it kosher to use DW-NOMINATE data to make time comparisons?
